posts.title: Context API
posts.body:
Context API and useContext are integral parts of React for managing global state and sharing data between components without manually passing props down through every level of the component tree.

Provider: It allows consuming components to subscribe to context changes. Providers supply the context to the consuming components.
Consumer: It allows consuming components to subscribe to context changes. Consumers consume the context supplied by the provider and re-render when the context value changes.
Context Object: It's an object that holds the shared data.

posts.title: useContext hook
posts.body: useContext is a React Hook that allows functional components to consume context. It accepts a context object (created by React.createContext) and returns the current context value for that context. useContext is an alternative to the Consumer component in class components.
